page.title: 15LANDSCAPE OF TYSOE - 1
page.content: Tysoe nestles at the foot of the escarpment between Tysoe Hill and Sunrising Hill. The landscape is a patchwork of fields with neatly trimmed hedges and a lot of trees, particularly in and around Upper Tysoe. Ridge and furrow can still be seen along the base of the escarpment which is wooded for 2/3 of its length with softwoods planted in the early 1960s. The proportion of arable fields to grassland is about 50/50. The trees are mainly oak, ash, and sycamore, with willows along the two main watercourses - Tysoe brook and Foxes brook.
